message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about weather patterns and the effects of a storm. After a storm, creek beds may be spilling over because the heavy rainfall can cause an increase in water levels and overflow from the natural water channels. Option (A) is incorrect because drinking water supply is not directly related to storms, unless there is damage to infrastructure. Option (B) is possible if the storm is severe enough to cause significant evaporation, but it is not a guaranteed outcome. Option (D) is not directly related to storms, as flowers can wilt and wither due to a variety of factors.
